SENT.plain: Stem cells undergo symmetric and asymmetric divisions to generate differentiated cells and more stem cells
The balance between self-renewal and differentiation of stem cells is controlled by transcription factors, epigenetic regulatory networks, and microRNAs (miRNAs)
Herein the miRNA involvement in the regulation of stem cell self-renewal and differentiation is summarized
miRNA contribution to malignancy through regulating cancer stem cells is described
In addition, the reciprocal associations between miRNAs and epigenetic modifications in control of stem cell fate are discussed
